bibl.title: Letter from Dean Cornwell to Philip Showalter Hench, May 10, 1941

div1.p: Cornwell thanks Hench for the data on foods affecting migraines, and for his interest in the yellow fever painting.

div1.head: Letter from Dean Cornwell to Philip Showalter Hench, May 10, 1941
div1.opener:
DEAN CORNWELL
GAINSBOROUGH STUDIOS
222 CENTRAL PARK SOUTH
N E W Y O R K C I T Y
May 10, 1941
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Care of the Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This is just a brief note to thank you for
your kindness in remembering to send me the data
on foods, and particularly migraine. I really
think the eggs are the thing in my case, as I
haven't had a bad headache since I quit eating
them. The biggest help has been the taking of
half a codine tablet and half an anacin tablet
on the occasional mornings when the symptoms
indicated a coming headache. In each case the
day was saved.

I also want to thank you for your interest
in the yellow fever picture. Beginning Monday
I start in in earnest to bring it to completion.
With all appreciation, I am,
